timeline.message: Add a better OutputStream impl

Make timer a instance field

Thus ensuring that QCL isn't referenced in a TimerThread
Null out the test class and instance
Shutdown event loop group
Don't create a Vert.x object from JAX-RS client if not necessary
Attempt to fix SSE test flakiness
Fix memory leak that causes tests to not unload classes
Fix broken bytecode recording for Quarkus REST Serialisers
Replace @RelaxesValidation with more fine grained @IgnoreProperties

Introduce QuarkusRestMessageBodyReader

The reason for having this is to avoid the need to do reflection
on the Resource method when input is needed
Move some ITs to quarkus-rest

Make certain runtime synthetic beans @ApplicationScoped

This is needed because when these beans are used
as injection points to static-init beans (like the
JAX-RS Resources created in Quarkus REST), Quarkus
fails to build

Move Hibernate related synthetic beans to static-init

This allows EntityManager to be injected into Resource classes
without thise classes having to be @ApplicationScoped
Fix race condition
Map Quarkus Security exceptions to appropriate HTTP codes
Split out the client into its own module
Change interface name
Disable flaky SSE test
Move the client proxy generation to the client module

Use a common resource for all interceptors

This also refactors a lot of the duplicated
interceptor handling logic.
Refactor interceptor discovery, to make it all BuildItem based
Fix erroneous extension file
Fixed extension descriptor locations
Added support for `@SseElementType` and more tests
Fixed bug in restart()
SSE: do not lose the target on restart
Forward exceptions properly

Fixed resource info visitor bug

we forgot to call visitEnd()
SSE test with no reconect
sse event source: better synchro
Better SSE handling of end reponse
Undisable SSE test
Remove unnecessary shutdown call
Add computing index
Move exception mappers to build items
Move invocation callback processing to the client
Add a build item for features and context resolvers
Add param converter build item
Move CDI to its own processor
Move method to scanning processor

Add support for per Resource class exception mapping

This is done via the @ExceptionMapper annotation
Instantiate instances lazily
Fix race condition that was causing the all sorts of Vert.x and Netty issues
Setup pom structure
Move common runtime module
Move the common deployment module
Move server runtime
Fix all the package names
Lots more renames, and move client

Move more logic out of the extension

Includes big refactor to the interceptor setup
Fix package name
Remove unused code for handler setup
Refactor to get rid of duplicate code in additional reader / writer handling
Better error handling for unrecoverable error

Log IOExceptions at debug level

This is the same thing as done in QuarkusErrorHandler for pure
Vert.x and the idea is to avoid filling the logs with exceptions
that are simply a result of the client closing the connection
Use new Quarkus REST ContainerRequestFilter for Micrometer extension
Use the proper order of writing the response when writer interceptors are used
Move move logic out of recorder
Move the last of the logic out of the recorder
Disallow the use of quarkus-rest and quarkus-resteasy at the same time
Replace custom @Blocking/@NonBlocking annotations with SR-Common annotations
Address potential NPE in score system
Add a HTTP abstraction
Remove vert.x dep on the server side
Add POC Servlet implementation
Create Vert.x module
Remove the additional ThreadLocal
Remove lambda usage from runtime modules of quarkus rest
Remove lambda usage from runtime modules of quarkus rest
Add back missing tests

Fix issue with injecting JAX-RS params into Request scoped Resources

Address jaxrs.platform.managedbean299.JAXRSClient
Use @ApplicationPath value

Reorganise param converters

Spec says that ParamConverterProvider must be called before we try our own
converters, so we do that, if there are any required.
We now generate static fields for converters in bean params and injectable resources
and static methods (one per converter) to initialise those converters.
We also generate a QuarkusRestInitialiser class that calls all those static methods
at startup.
This way beanparams and injectable resources never instantiate their converters
at every invocation.
This doesn't support Lazy but I doubt we care
I disable all reflection usage if there are no ParamConverterProvider registered
Note that this doesn't work wrt generics, it doesn't look like we map them properly
for resource methods

Ensure that ParamConverterProvider are used

Addresses jaxrs.jaxrs21.ee.priority.JAXRSClient
Tweak string param converter
Added notes in README

Asyncresponse: cancel via Response instead of WAE

This just dodges a TCK test, but RESTEasy does it too
Updated README for non-implemented stuff
README update
Fix request scope handling

Improve Json handling

Done after testing Quarkus-REST with the quickstarts
More provider handling updates
Add a SPI module intended to integration with other extensions

Fix Accepts header parsing in ClassRoutingHandler

This was uncovered by manual. The browser seems to have
been sending:

text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/webp,*/*;q=0.8

Replace Filter approach with Route approach

This is similar to what quarkus-resteasy standalone does
and is needed in order to allow other vert.x routes
(for example metrics routes) to work
Filter provider classes according to detected application classes

Temporarily hold on to the Application class from build to static init

This can't work, and doesn't in fact for some tests which require external stuff
like javax.validation from the Application class, but it gets us further running the TCK
Ensure that Application.getClasses filters Resources as well

Fix issue with @ApplicationPath("/")

Addresses jaxrs.jaxrs21.ee.client.executor.async.JAXRSClient
Support security checks by firing the right CDI event and adding excpetion mappers for auth exceptions
Accept application-specified providers even if they're not marked with `@Provider`
Add support for @CookieParam, @PathParam and @MatrixParam in ctor
Ensure Resource methods have the proper Java modifiers
Add support for singletons

When a provider is used in Application, it should only be registered with the server

For now this only applies to providers that already had a constraint, but we probably
need to add this to the rest of providers as well
Fix writer interceptor priority
Fix writer interceptor order
Ensure that the final type and media type set by interceptors is used

Replaced our specific number readers with one for Number

Because the TCK wants the user to be able to override it for Number
which we can't if we declare one more specific for Integer
Also treat readers/writers for primitives by looking up reader/writers for
the wrapper types
Move byte[]/InputStream readers away from only-if-used reader list since they're
builtin now
Move DefaultTextPlainBodyHandler up to the builtins otherwise we will
register it against Integer and again Number will not match

Make writer selection based on MediaType more compliant

Addresses jaxrs.spec.provider.sort.JAXRSClient

Get of a lot of ugly MediaTypeMapper code

Utilize the recently enhanced ServerMediaType#negotiate
which provides the same functionality
Decode @ApplicationPath value if necessary
byte[] provider should be for both server and client
Support for global name bindings
Implement SseBroadcaster listeners
Pass annotations to server readFrom
Remove unnecessary injection of Jsonb
Fixed context resolver media type resolution
Fix path matcher bug
Add support for setEntityStream

Support async completions

Well actually not ConnectionCallback but the TCK doesnt test it
Remove setThrowable/getThrowable because other callers used
handleException and we had different behaviour, so now we have a single code path
for exceptions.
Added ExceptionHandler which begins the abortChain, and removed it from ResponseHandler
since any exception thrown in the normal path will lead us on the abortChain
Move request context termination to close(), to make sure we always close it
Bring Smallrye Metrics support to Quarkus REST
Fix potential NPE
Add Dev Mode 404 page to quarkus-rest
Move setup of CDI request context for dev mode 404 handling to proper location
Unwrap async types at build time for writer selection
README update
Avoid void methods when trying to find a writer
build-time writer selection and primitives
merge two writer selection methods, fix lookup when finding a writer for an interface type
Fix request scope issue with Dev-mode 404 handler

Make String endpoints produce [text/plain, */*] by default

Had to tweak the negociation for this to work, but those are bug fixes anyway
Added toString on bean factories
Fixed a non-deterministic bug I re-introduced while refactoring findWriters earlier

Make the new String default produces configurable

Actually you can only get the new behaviour in two forms: single produces
or multiple produces with negotiation (for TCK)
Add quarkus-rest support to Micrometer
Don't instantiate JAX-RS Application unless it's necessary or requested
Make sure we don't create multiple instances of the same MessageBodyWriter
Don't add ContainerFilter handler steps if no filters exist
Apply minor optimizations JAX-RS Response handling

Add annotation that can control whether the CDI request scope will be activated or not

This is useful in resource methods where we know that no request scope beans come into play
Start of a scoring system
Do not register CS/Uni/Multi unless we can determine they're used at build time
Score was missing some cases for writers
"Override" utility methods in QuarkusRestResponse
Avoid copying HTTP headers when building Response from Builder

Added a resource visitor for navigating our resources

Experience in RESTEasy shows that we need this to not reimplement it everywhere, and we want
to make it as abstract/reusable as possible
Use slightly faster vertx header encoding
Remove unnecessary setting of status message in final response

Avoid getStringHeaders when encoding the result

This is done in order to avoid filling an intermediate map

Added our variant of response/request filters where we can add our methods

Also made each filter into its own handler

Async filters

We have our own subtype of response/request filter interfaces, which take
our own subtype of response/request context, which have extra methods.
I've made it so all the suspend/resume action is on the request, instead of
both request and response, simply because the response filter have the request
context anyway, so it didn't make much sense to duplicate those actions in both
contexts, since they do the same damn thing.
Introduced a public face for QuarkusRestRequestContext, which doesn't have a very
nice name, but at least can get injection and is more decent for users.
Moved Completion/ConnectionCallbacks to the context, because I've always hated
that I needed the AsyncResponse to get them, most times you want them regardless
of whether the request is sync or async.
Support annotation-less path parameters
New value-less param annotations

Introduce SimplifiedResourceInfo as alternative to ResourceInfo

ResourceInfo means that the we need to do reflection on the method.
Often the data in SimplifiedResourceInfo is enough (in things like filters)
so no reflection is needed (as this information is available when building the
RuntimeResource)
Introduce @ContainerRequestFilter as a better way to write request filters
Introduce @ContainerResponseFilter as a better way to write response filters
Autoinject context parameters even without `@Context` if we know their type
New injectable context type
Support async filters in the new filter declarations
Decrease cost of checking HTTP headers and @Produces/@Consumes compatibility

Don't allocate the Response unless it is required

Also try and avoid MediaType.toString, as it is slow
Minor perf improvement
Use spec compliant content-type header name

Apply minor performance optimization

Store the http method in the context as it's not dirt cheap to obtain
and is needed at least twice (during Class Routing and during Response Writing)
Apply tiny performance improvement for the fast path

Apply another minor performance improvement

We hold on to the HttpServerResponse from Vert.x instead
of looking it up everytime

Improve Smallrye Metrics integration into Quarkus REST

In Quarkus REST we don't need the ugly Vert.x callback.
Moreover we can right the filter in a more elegant and more
performant manner.

Make OpenTracing work with Quarkus REST

This is a breaking change as opentracing no longer
has a hard dependency on resteasy
Add spec notes
Add HttpServerReqeuest/Response in container filters

Remember we created the request context otherwise we never destroy it

Also destroy our context since we saved it, that's what RR does and should
save a TL
Improve performance of Accepts / @Produces compatibility check
Make tiny performance improvement in media type matching
Add a better OutputStream impl
Don't allocate list/iterators if not required
Use indexed iteration to avoid allocation
Don't pause for GET requests
Use raw method
More notes for spec

timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            name: "Quarkus REST JSON-B"
          
          
            
            name: "Quarkus REST Jackson"
timeline.author: machi1990

replies.bodyText: 👍 . I'll change it when I go through the commit history and try to clean it up
replies.author: geoand

timeline.message: Refactor interceptor discovery, to make it all BuildItem based
Remove unnecessary shutdown call
Instantiate instances lazily
Added Qute DEV Templates
Instantiate instances lazily
Instantiate instances lazily
Refactor to get rid of duplicate code in additional reader / writer handling
Replace custom @Blocking/@NonBlocking annotations with SR-Common annotations
Remove lambda usage from runtime modules of quarkus rest
Add support for InputStream writer in client

Client null InputStream means no body now

Also make sure to reserialise the entity body to the response context IS before
running the response filters
Configurations can now contain messageBodyReader/Writer

Address jaxrs.spec.template.JAXRSClient0000

Fix subtle issues in template matching
On dymamic media type resolution, prefer media type of method

Address jaxrs.spec.resource.responsemediatype.JAXRSClient

When there is no response body, use produces media type if it exists
Address some of JAXRSClient0131
Handle sub resources that are not beans

Initial work on ParamConverters

Mostly contains some EndpointIndexer refactoring that I don't want to conflict
README: spec notes

Further Responses fixes for the TCK

Handle multi-headers in client response
Make sure headers are case-insensitive
Do not turn entities to strings without going through the readers
Properly prefix the base URI for ResponseBuilder.location

Address jaxrs.spec.resource.responsemediatype.JAXRSClient

Return HTTP 406 when the selected media type is a star subtype
and the type is other than star or application

Address jaxrs.spec.provider.writer.JAXRSClient

According to the spec, when a method returns Response
that has its media type set, that media type is selected

Work on UriInfo, paths and decoding

Path params were not decoded
Some paths were obtained with or without prefix
 it doesn't help that we let anyone access the vertx request and that
 even that one has two paths (normalised or not)
Fixed bug in Encode for decoding URIs, for now just use the Vertx decoder
which appears to be sane and reasonably implemented.

Make sure we set the vertx headers after we run the client writer interceptors

Becuase they can set headers

Address jaxrs.spec.provider.writer.JAXRSClient

Writers need to be resolved in a deterministic order
defined by the spec
Add more info to spec notes
Another note about the spec
Add support for parameter converters
Add support for PathSegment
Add a todo later to README
Fix path matcher bug
ExceptionMapping: further fixes wrt WAE handling

Fixes to AsyncResponse.cancel

TCK expects that when using Date we get a date header field
Add some additional injectables

Address jaxrs.spec.client.typedentities.JAXRSClient#clientMultivaluedMapReaderTest

The spec mandates that when the accept header is present, it must be used
to determine the writes. Furthermore we need to make sure that
the proper content type is returned based on the media type negotiation
between the accept headers and the selected writer's supported media types

Address jaxrs.spec.provider.writer.JAXRSClient

Make sure we use the proper spec mandated order for build-time
resolvable writers
Use correct response code for sub resources
More path fixes
Abort chain handling
AsyncResponse: support timeout

java.io.Reader is now tied the wildcard media type

This is needed by the TCK and also matches what RESTEasy does
SSE fixes for TCK

Added built-in readers for spec types such as Character, Boolean, Number

I could not find a way to make an all-in-one like we did for string/primitives writer

Address jaxrs.spec.resource.requestmatching.JAXRSClient

Make MediaTypeMapper spec compatible

Address jaxrs.spec.provider.reader.JAXRSClient

Make Reader selection spec compliant

Fix issues with Reader handling

Address jaxrs.spec.provider.reader.JAXRSClient
Address jaxrs.spec.ee.rs.constrainedto.JAXRSClient
Basic support for @Encoded
Better handling of entities with no content
registration improvements
Handle encoded form params
More fixes around registration
Don't resolve reader until the interceptors have run
Added note about multimap in README

Ensure that global interceptors are used when handling exceptions

Addresses jaxrs.spec.filter.exception.JAXRSClient

Address jaxrs.spec.provider.standardnotnull.JAXRSClient

Spec says that the client's readEntity should throw a
ProcessingException when an IOException is caught

Removed a second MultivaluedMapImpl, added QuarkusMultivaluedHashMap

Also fix put/putAll in MultivaluedTreeMap

Replace all usages of MultivaluedHashMap with QuarkusMultivaluedHashMap

Added QuarkusMultivaluedMap with the missing addAll and use it
Further notes in README

Apply general cleanup

Refactored stuff from QuarkusRestClientResponseContext and QuarkusRestResponse into HeaderUtil
Removed HttpHeaderNames

Do some more general cleanup

Removed extra RESTEasy classes in favour of JAXRS classes or consolidation

Don't use Vertx Json writter when the entity is a String

This is needed because the encoding process adds extra quotes

Addresses jaxrs.platform.provider.jsonp.JAXRSClient

Handle more specific Jsonp types

Addresses jaxrs.jaxrs21.platform.providers.jsonp.JAXRSClient
Added note about pre-serialised JSON strings
More header refactoring in favour of HeaderUtil
cookie fixes
Fixed RestClient.invocation(Link link)

Try to honour request filters which change the requestUri

We keep the scheme/authority as well as the path
We probably should use the query part, but I didn't see that tested in the TCK
Also do not set the input stream in the input handler if the request filters
set it

Properly handle name bindings on class

Address jaxrs.spec.filter.namebinding.JAXRSClient
Fix TCK weirdness in Resource Locator handling

Ensure proper priorities are used for ExceptionMapper and ParamConverterProvider

Addresses jaxrs.jaxrs21.ee.priority.JAXRSClient

ReaderInterceptor and WriterInterceptor can now be registered in a DynamicFeature

Address jaxrs.spec.filter.dynamicfeature.JAXRSClient

Address jaxrs.api.rs.core.configuration.JAXRSClient

Implement RestConfiguration#getContracts

Address flakiness jaxrs.ee.rs.beanparam.cookie.plain.JAXRSClient

The TCK seems to expect that fields of a @BeanParam class that
are also @BeanParam themselves are handled last
client response: reset the stream before returning it

Address jaxrs.api.rs.core.responseclient.JAXRSClient

This really sucks, but probably better than nothing..

Fix selection of methods based on the request content-type

We want to make sure we pick the best content-type we consume, rather
than the content-type the user sends.
Register RxInvocationProvider in Configuration

Implement QuarkusRestContainerResponseContext#getEntityStream

Address jaxrs.ee.rs.container.responsecontext.JAXRSClient

Make HEAD and OPTIONS handling more spec compliant

Address jaxrs.ee.rs.get.JAXRSClient

Fix issue with injecting JAX-RS params into Request scoped Resources

Address jaxrs.platform.managedbean299.JAXRSClient
Use @ApplicationPath value

Reorganise param converters

Spec says that ParamConverterProvider must be called before we try our own
converters, so we do that, if there are any required.
We now generate static fields for converters in bean params and injectable resources
and static methods (one per converter) to initialise those converters.
We also generate a QuarkusRestInitialiser class that calls all those static methods
at startup.
This way beanparams and injectable resources never instantiate their converters
at every invocation.
This doesn't support Lazy but I doubt we care
I disable all reflection usage if there are no ParamConverterProvider registered
Note that this doesn't work wrt generics, it doesn't look like we map them properly
for resource methods

Ensure that ParamConverterProvider are used

Addresses jaxrs.jaxrs21.ee.priority.JAXRSClient
Tweak string param converter
Exception mapping: do the hierarchy even for WAE, as per TCK
Added notes in README

Asyncresponse: cancel via Response instead of WAE

This just dodges a TCK test, but RESTEasy does it too
Updated README for non-implemented stuff
README update
Fix request scope handling

Improve Json handling

Done after testing Quarkus-REST with the quickstarts
More provider handling updates
Add a SPI module intended to integration with other extensions

Fix Accepts header parsing in ClassRoutingHandler

This was uncovered by manual. The browser seems to have
been sending:

text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/webp,*/*;q=0.8

Replace Filter approach with Route approach

This is similar to what quarkus-resteasy standalone does
and is needed in order to allow other vert.x routes
(for example metrics routes) to work
Filter provider classes according to detected application classes

Temporarily hold on to the Application class from build to static init

This can't work, and doesn't in fact for some tests which require external stuff
like javax.validation from the Application class, but it gets us further running the TCK
Use the method parameter annotations for the body reader
